topics.body: Well, I don't frequent this thread, so I don't know how it is here, but "@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5372648d6368720134360400#post_5372648d6368720134360400, you are a wee bit too enthusiastic to bring up mecha. I mean, from what I can remember from the Kill la Kill thread, you talked more about mecha shows than about KlK. Tone it down a bit if you can.

topics.author: 4fded3ad945b700aaa01381d

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53726b7b63687201771b0000#post_53726b7b63687201771b0000
[bq="trashboat"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53726b27636872013a8e0000#post_53726b27636872013a8e0000
Just do what I suggested before this shitstorm started, Get the first episode in if you think you have the time to do it (I believe It's about 55 minutes long)[/bq]
I don't think you have any background into any programming languages to accurately judge the amount of free time I'll have.  I'm working towards learning C++, SQL, computer modeling, computer animation and so forth in only two years and going to have to learn it to such a degree that I'll be able to do everything when it comes to making video games.  Making video games is not a art degree; it's not something you can breeze through it with the professors all letting you slide into the next class with a B.  Now imagine having to make a 4.0 grade point average in all of your classes and having a job on top of that.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

Overnight, Giant robo the animation: The day the earth stood still has become my Favorite work of fiction of all time, It really spoke to me, Pretty much everything about it was Perfect, The characters, The animation, The soundtrack, The pacing, I feel like everyone needs to see this Work of art

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5372706a63687202b29b0200#post_5372706a63687202b29b0200
I don't hate you, but the thing that I've been trying to explain to you is that if I were to follow your advice I would not be able to hold a job or continue my education or pay my bills and would be out on the street with no food because you have your priorities backwards.  Paying food bills, electricity, water, going to college and getting your degree should be higher on the list of priorities than watching anime.

To be perfectly honest that's why my college has such a high dropout rate; people don't understand to put work and college before screwing around watching anime and wind up failing all their classes.  If I were to follow your advice and watch all the shows you recommend I would be out on the street with no food.

The only reason why I'm even on right now is because I'm waiting for my interview for a potential job.

Tl:dr;
College and work to pay bills > watching anime
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
